ratings.comment: I took this class with no prior physics knowledge, and I did alright.  The math they would have you do on tests was walked through in discussion.  Lectures were not necessary.  The first two exams were a bit difficult, but the final was the easiest.  You will also have to do homework every week, which isn't hard if you have the textbook.

Overall this class was pretty easy. Attendance and textbooks are not required. If you do go to lecture, it is somewhat hard to understand him due to his accent, and he has a tendency to get off topic. Most if not all of the answers for homework and tests can be found online if you are struggling. Totally recommend this for a science credit!

Lazarian is fine but his lectures are a little bit interesting, he tends to get off topic sometimes. Overall his class was relatively easy but he was not the best lecturer ever. Good communicator though
